trans-unit.source: Network security rules define a pattern of traffic to be enabled or denied.
trans-unit.target: Network security rules define a pattern of traffic to be enabled or denied.

trans-unit.source: Network security rules are contained within a Network Security Group (NSG).
trans-unit.target: Network security rules are contained within a Network Security Group (NSG).

trans-unit.source: NSGs can be applied at the subnet or NIC level.
trans-unit.target: NSGs can be applied at the subnet or NIC level.

trans-unit.source: Default network security rules are created to protect your virtual network by default.
trans-unit.target: Default network security rules are created to protect your virtual network by default.

trans-unit.source: It is not possible to edit or delete a default network security rule, but they can be overridden by creating a network security rule with a lower priority.
trans-unit.target: It is not possible to edit or delete a default network security rule, but they can be overridden by creating a network security rule with a lower priority.

trans-unit.source: Default network security rules have priorities of 65000 and greater.
trans-unit.target: Default network security rules have priorities of 65000 and greater.

trans-unit.source: To override a default network security rule, create a network security rule with a priority of less than 65000.
trans-unit.target: To override a default network security rule, create a network security rule with a priority of less than 65000.

trans-unit.source: The following information is common to all tasks:
trans-unit.target: The following information is common to all tasks:

trans-unit.source: Replace {subscription-id} with your subscription identifier in the URI.
trans-unit.target: Replace {subscription-id} with your subscription identifier in the URI.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Using Resource groups to manage your Azure resources</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/azure-preview-portal-using-resource-groups</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Using Resource groups to manage your Azure resources</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/azure-preview-portal-using-resource-groups</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Set the Content-Type header to application/json.
trans-unit.target: Set the Content-Type header to application/json.

trans-unit.source: Set the Authorization header to a JSON Web Token that you obtain from Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Set the Authorization header to a JSON Web Token that you obtain from Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="a1caa0f7-3250-46ed-95b5-8603d902383b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="a1caa0f7-3250-46ed-95b5-8603d902383b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests</link>.
